course_title: Topics in Biomedical Informatics: Biomed. Stats. Mach. Learning
class_notes:
Biomedical Statistics for Machine Learning
This course can be used to satisfy the BIOS 506 requirement for the BMI track of the CSI graduate program. This accelerated course will introduce students to the description and analysis of clinical data using approaches varying from univariate statistical tests to hierarchical linear models. The main body of the course is divided into three sections: fundamental results in statistical inference and probability, inference within a sample with multivariate regression and hypothesis tests, and predicting data in new samples with cross-validation and other techniques.


We will make special accommodations for online instruction for this course. Your instructor will communicate the mode of instruction before the start of classes.


Class will be held in BMI classroom, 4th floor Woodruff Memorial Research Building (Rm 4004)
course_description: This is a special topics course in Biomedical Informatics.
